description.p: Kibi is a configurable text editor with UTF-8 support, incremental search, syntax highlighting, line numbers and more, written in less than 1024 lines of Rust with minimal dependencies.
Kibi is compatible with Linux, macOS, and Windows.

ul.li: Adds support for the NO_COLOR standard: all color output will be disabled if the NO_COLOR environment variable is set
Improves Ctrl-R behavior on last line
Fixes regression when pressing right/delete at end of line
Prevents an unnecessary screen refresh, blinking welcome message when opening existing file
Adds support for end-of-options delimiter -- (following POSIX.1-2024 12. Utility Conventions), allowing Kibi to be used as the editor for the sudoers file with visudo
Fixes crash when backspace was pressed in find mode with empty search field
New features: delete, copy, cut and paste lines with Ctrl-R, Ctrl-C, Ctrl-X, Ctrl-V

New syntax highlighting configurations for C, C#, C++, CoffeeScript, CSS, D, Dart, Elixir, Fish, Go, Groovy, Haskell, HTML, Java, JavaScript, Julia, Kotlin, LRC, Lua, Markdown, MATLAB, Nim, Nix, NoSQL, Nushell, OCaml, Perl, PHP, PowerShell, Processing, PRQL, R, Racket, Ruby, Raku, RSS, Scala, SQL, Swift, TypeScript, XML, YAML, Zig, ZSH, and support for Extension-less dotfiles
Adds support for WebAssembly, and optimizes binaries across all platforms for performance and size
Avoids flicking when quickly resizing the terminal windows
Fixes crashes when opening a new file
Adds error messages when an invalid option is provided, or trying to open a special file
Makes configuration parsing more resilient: prohibit invalid durations and tab sizes, emit warnings instead of panicking for invalid configurations
New feature: execute external commands directly from the editor
Adds syntax highlighting configuration for the V Programming Language
Improves errors messages for file opening (e.g. configuration file permissions)
Fixes crash on Android devices related to SELinux
Adds support for language-specific configuration of quote characters
Removes 2 crate dependencies (nix, signal-hooks)
Removes highlight_strings syntax highlighting configuration
Adds support for Windows
Adds a `--version` argument to the binary
Complies with the XDG base directory specification for configuration files
Fixes find behavior to match raw characters, not rendered ones
Fixes a crash when inserting a new line in the middle of a row
Fixes syntax highlighting not updating when inserting new lines or after pressing backspace
Fixes syntax highlighting when UTF-8 characters are present in the row
Adds support for UTF-8 characters
New feature: duplicate the current row with Ctrl+D
Adds syntax highlighting configuration for bash
Fixes path for system-wide configuration file
Fixes final new line being omitted when opening a file
Fixes erroneous field in the example configuration
Adds an example of configuration file
Fixes invalid package metadata

Kibi in action: creating and editing a file, with syntax highlighting and search feature
